AboutManaging PartnerAdvisorsPortfolioPressContact us

Taver Capital is a venture fund that invests in early stage artificial intelligence companies from around the world.

About

Taver Capital is a venture fund that invests in early stage artificial intelligence companies from around the world. When Taver Capital was launched, it was one of the only firms specialized in AI, an industry expected to bring at least $15 trillion to the world economy by 2030.

Taver Capital invests throughout the world, capitalising on a wide network of local expertise and insight that provides competitive advantage in a variety of locales just where it is needed. It sources deals through its network of entrepreneurs and scientists globally.

Managing Partner

Mikhail Taver

Managing Partner

Mikhail has done over 250 deals in 20 years of M&A and Private Equity. Ex-executive of Nafta-Moskva (one of Russia's most successful financial groups at the time). Former executive of AAR consortium (Alfa Group, Access Industries and Renova Group), management of 50% stake in TNK-BP, a joint venture of the largest oil companies of Russia and the UK. Mikhail holds CFA, ACMA and CGMA designations.

Show More

Partners & Advisors

Advisor

Kanishka Roy

Kanishka is a CFO at SmartNews, a leading global news discovery company. He is a former technology investment banker, growth investor and industry executive.

Advisor

Mel Guymon

Mel is an entrepreneur and an investor, former Vice President of Search Product Management at Yahoo. Before that, he spent 8 years at Google working with both the Search and Google.org teams. A former nuclear submarine officer.

Partner

Mindset Consulting

Mindset Consulting is an award-winning, Madrid-based strategic communications firm for tech companies & VC funds in the United States & Europe.

‍

Partner

SDVentures

SDVentures is an investment fund focused on social discovery and bringing people together.

Show all

Press

PromptPod Podcast

Danny Kirk, the host of PromptPod, interviewed our founder and Managing Partner, Mikhail Taver, to get his insights in regards to deeptech. Taver expressed his views on generative AI and how it can influence the investing landscape, and reaffirmed his conviction that heavy industries, which now seem to be stagnating, can be given a second wind with the right AI tools.

Pittsburgh Technology Council

An interview with Brandon Contino, co-founder and CEO of our portfolio company Four Growers, an ag robotics startup that can harvest faster than humans and boasts an automated AI platform that leverages data analytics to help farmers increase their yields.

Yahoo

Our portfolio company Regology, which is the leading regulatory intelligence platform, launched RegIntel, a generative AI solution created to enhance regulatory compliance. Built on top of Regology's cutting-edge, real-time database, RegIntel will help users to save thousands of hours, simplify complex regulatory requirements, and provide reliable and citable summaries.

AboutManaging PartnerAdvisorsPortfolioPressContact us

Press

PromptPod Podcast

Mikhail Taver Discusses Deeptech Investing and AI in PromptPod Podcast

Danny Kirk, the host of PromptPod, interviewed our founder and Managing Partner, Mikhail Taver, to get his insights in regards to deeptech. Taver expressed his views on generative AI and how it can influence the investing landscape, and reaffirmed his conviction that heavy industries, which now seem to be stagnating, can be given a second wind with the right AI tools.

Pittsburgh Technology Council

Meet the founder: Four Growers on building Ag robots that harvest faster than humans

An interview with Brandon Contino, co-founder and CEO of our portfolio company Four Growers, an ag robotics startup that can harvest faster than humans and boasts an automated AI platform that leverages data analytics to help farmers increase their yields.

Yahoo

Regology Introduces RegIntel to Transform Regulatory Compliance with Generative AI

Our portfolio company Regology, which is the leading regulatory intelligence platform, launched RegIntel, a generative AI solution created to enhance regulatory compliance. Built on top of Regology's cutting-edge, real-time database, RegIntel will help users to save thousands of hours, simplify complex regulatory requirements, and provide reliable and citable summaries.

Understanding Venture

Understanding Venture Capital Podcast with Mikhail Taver

Mikhail Taver, founder and Managing Partner of Taver Capital, was a guest on the Understanding Venture Capital podcast, where he shared important pieces of advice for founders and investors alike. He emphasized that even though financial knowledge is critical, understanding people and the psychology behind a company is equally important.

Small Caps

Tivan teams up with Earth AI to fast-track discoveries at Sandover

Our portfolio company EARTH AI has entered into a strategic alliance with Tivan to collaborate on exploration activities across the Sandover Lithium Project, located in Northern Territory, Australia. Under the deal, Earth AI will be appointed exploration manager and oversee day-to-day project management, including all activities and permitting.

The National Law Review

Regology’s Analysis to Predict Lawmaking Activity by the 117th Congress

This month the term of the 116th Congress of the United States came to an end, and the 117th Congress convened its first of two sessions, for a total term of 24 months. To get a sense of what could be expected as the transition is made from one Congress to the next, our portfolio company Regology performed an analysis of the legislative activity of the past 9 terms of Congress.

EU-Startups

“Everyone can become a city farmer”: Interview with iFarm’s co-founder and CEO Max Chizhov

An interview with Max Chizhov, co-founder and CEO of Helsinki-based iFarm, a startup founded in 2017 who are providing ‘plug&play’ automated vertical farms for stores, restaurants, warehouses and even homes.

AiThority

Regology Launches Global Regulatory Management & Alerts For 20 Countries

Regology, an AI-based regulatory compliance platform, announces the launch of its global legal management and alerts system to help regulatory professionals remain updated with local regulations around the world.

InsurTech

Regology introduces a new regulation system for 20 countries

Using artificial intelligence (AI), the company’s system is able to scale millions of laws across the aforementioned 20 locations (including the US, Germany, France, Canada and others) and set billions of links between them.

Biometric Update

ID R&D voice biometrics and anti-spoofing now available to developers through Microsoft Azure Marketplace

Voice biometrics and anti-spoofing capabilities from ID R&D are now available for Microsoft Azure customers to build into their apps.

Forbes

Robotizēts sportists

Bez tehnoloģijām neiztikt nekur, arī sportā. Pašmāju jaunuzņēmums Winmill jau pāris gadu ļauj hokejistiem trenēties inovatīvāk. Tagad pienākusi beisbolistu kārta.

Dienas Bizness

Sporta treniņu iekārtas padara gudrākas

Sporta tehnoloģiju uzņēmuma "Winmill" treniņu iekārtas hokejam un beisbolam ļauj spēlētājiem trenēties neatkarīgi no citiem, kuri citos apstākļos padotu bumbu vai ripu.

Business Insider

We got an exclusive look at the pitch deck indoor farming startup iFarm used to raise $4 million

iFarm's indoor farm tech is automated and allows customers to start growing salads, greens, berries and vegetables in urban environments.

TechCrunch

Agtech startup iFarm bags $4M to help vertical farms grow more tasty stuff

The Finnish startup is focused on providing software that enables others to carry out vertical farming — targeting sales at food processing companies and FMCG giants, as well as farmers, university research centers and even large corporates with their own catering needs as a result of operating large physical office footprints.

VentureBeat

iFarm Raises $4 million to automate urban farming with AI and drones

iFarm has raised $4 million to expand its automated system that uses AI and drones to grow fruits and vegetables in enclosed spaces. Gagarin Capital led the round of funding, which included investment from Matrix Capital, Impulse VC, IMI.VC, and some business angels.

VentureBeat

Cherry Labs raises $5.2 million for AI that detects when elderly users fall

Cherry Home, their AI in-home system, is able to prevent such injuries in the first place and call for help if they do happen.

VentureBeat

Gosu.ai raises $1.9 million to automate game training advice

Alisa Chumachenko, the founder of Game Insight, is back with a new startup called Gosu.ai, which she bills as a training lab that combines artificial intelligence and personalized advice to come up with coaching tips for would-be esports athletes.

Les Echos

Sterblue automatise le vol des drones d'inspection

Sterblue vient de boucler une première levée de fonds de 2 millions de dollars auprès The Westly Group, Innogy New Ventures, Gagarin Capital, d'entrepreneurs, tel Peter Reinhardt, cofondateur de Segment, du fonds EDP Ventures ou du Contrarian Ventures.

Fortune

Fortune: Term Sheet — Tuesday, October 23

Wallarm, a South San Francisco-based provider of AI-powered application security, raised $8 million in Series A funding. Toba Capital led the round, and was joined by investors including Y Combinator, Partech and Gagarin Capital.

Fortune

Fortune: Term Sheet — Friday, August 31

Openland, a professional messenger for real estate, raised $2.25 million in funding. Investors include Gagarin Capital, Sinai Ventures, Soma Capital, Liquid 2 Ventures, Rainfall Ventures, Y Combinator, and Day One Ventures.

TechCrunch

AI game trainer Gosu.ai raises $1.9M to give gamers a virtual assistant

Gosu.ai has developed an AI assistant to help gamers play smarter and improve their skills. It’s now raised a $1.9M funding round led by Runa Capital, with participation from Ventech and existing investor, Sistema_VC.

Digital Trends

Who needs Stitch Fix? Maison Me uses A.I. to custom design clothing just for you

Maison Me got a big boost from a $1 million seed round by Founders Fund, Gagarin Capital, and the much-lauded Google Assistant Investment Program.

peHUB

peHUB

RocketBody raises $1 mln.

Finovate

Finovate

The latest version of ID R&D’s voice solution leverages AI and voice technology to give users a major boost in biometric matching speed.

Morningstar

Morningstar

ID R&D Raises $5.7 Million in Series A Funding.

Money

US News & World Report: How to Invest in Venture Capital

Mikhail Taver believes that investing a small portion of funds in venture capital offers the opportunity for significant upside potential, with limited risk.

TechCrunch

YC’s Earth AI closes funding for its platform to make mining less wasteful

After closing a financing round of up to $2.5 million from Gagarin Capital, Earth AI was announced in Y Combinator’s latest cohort due to present at the YC Demo Day this week.

Fortune

Fortune: Term Sheet — Tuesday, February 12

iFarm Project, a Russia-based developer of modular automated farms to produce natural vegetables, salads, and berries year-round, raised $1 million in funding.
